comments.text:
Yeah but what I'm saying is that BTS isn't encouraging their fans or other 
people to drop school. They are simply saying not to let it control you. 
It's good to value education, but it's also about finding something you 
love to do for the rest of your life. Yes you need the finances but does 
everyone succeed in becoming educationally successful? No. Everybody has a 
job and wants a good one. My whole point here is that you should chase your 
dreams too and that my idol oppas are not encouraging anyone to rebel 
against school. Like I said, they value education deeply. It is a part of 
not just the Asian culture, but others as well. With all due respect, why 
would you ask her that if you don't even know her at all? For all you know 
she can do most of those things or maybe even all. What if she planned to 
be just like them and that you're one of those people who shut her down? I 
understand that you might have not done it on purpose, but that's what you 
came off as. But you're right though. Education is important. I completely 
agree with you on that. But you can't let it control you. You can do both. 
Chasing your dreams all while getting a full education. That's what most of 
the idols are doing.
comments.author: annedreamer101

comments.text:

comments.text:
+Fahrenheit527love U gotta have what it takes to do well in life before u 
quit school. Are u as talented as those kids? Can u dance and sing and rap 
as well as they do? Have u debuted as artists? Or are ur parents REALLY 
rich and can put u through elite education just with money? Or r u pretty 
enough to marry into rich family? So don't have naughty thoughts and do 
well in school to maximize ur chance at succeeding in life as the rest of 
us do. 
But there is nothing wrong with having a dream when u r young because u 
have time to figure out what u have to do. I dream about different things 
to do with my life when i was young as well, but sometimes life force u 
into completely different directions. 
All I'm saying is that a high school diploma is the least u need to have to 
get u into a place in life where u have time to think about what u wanna do 
next without worrying where ur next meal will come from. But this video and

comments.text:
Hi there fellow ARMY! If you still don't know who's who, I'll help you!

0:15 is Jungkook. Real name is Jeon Jeongguk. Or Jungkook. He's currently 
17 turning 18, but in this MV he is 16. He's the maknae or youngest in the 
group. He's a vocal, a rapper, and a dancer.
Birthday is Sept. 1, 1997.

0:17 is the big bro. Kim Seokjin or Jin. He's the visual and one of the 
vocals. His age is currently 22 turning 23. In this MV he was 20 because 
his birthday is Dec. 4, 1992.

0:18 is leader-nim Kim Namjoon. His stage name is Rap Monster. He's the 
fourth oldest in the group. He is also the one, along with two other 
members, who compose and produce their songs. He is their rapper, hence the 
name. He is currently 20 turning 21. In this MV his birthday was just 2 
days away (Sept. 12, 1994), so that makes him 18. 

0:19 is their dancing machine, Jung Hoseok or J-Hope. He is also one of the 
producers of their songs. He serves as the rapper and dancer of their 
group. He and Rap Monster are the same age. He is the 3rd oldest in the 
group.He was only 19 in this MV, but currently he just turned 21. His 
birthday is on Feb. 18, 1994.

0:21 is their speed rapper, Min Yoongi or SUGA. He is also one of the 
producers of the group. He is the 2nd oldest in the group. He was 20 in 
this MV, but this year he just turned 22. His birthday is on Mar. 9, 1993.

0:23 is the most handsome one. Kim Taehyung AKA V. V is their vocalist and 
the 2nd oldest in the maknae line. He was 17 turning 18 in this MV. He is 
now 19 turning 20 this year. His birthday is on Dec. 30, 1995.

0:24 remember the one who lifted his shirt in the 'No More Dream' video? 
His name is Park Jimin or Jimin. He is the oldest in the maknae line. He 
and V are the same age. He is 17 turning 18 in this MV. His birthday is on 
Oct. 13, 1995.

Well, that's the basics! Hope you learn more about them in the future (You 
have to!). In their MVs they are charming but offstage they are real dorks! 
Trust me, you'll love them!
comments.author: MeMxDoM13

top_comment.text:
I don't really think this song is about just rebelling against school. That 
hardly scratches the surface. It's about not living in the confides of 
someone else's (i.e your parents or teachers) expectations because that's 
what they did; not pushing your personal ambitions aside to say "It'll 
happen one day" when you can say "I can make it happen now."
A lot of people (including myself) have had experiences in school where 
they feel their being oppressed or pressured because, somewhere along the 
line, school became less about your ideas/hopes/dreams/creative aspirations 
and actual learning, and more about rote memorization and competition. I 
think a lot of the song speaks towards that issue. ﻿
top_comment.author: powerpuff4ever

comments.text: SI  ME ENCANTA
comments.author: tripleimagen

comments.text:
at first i thought the same... but no its not the school ! it was like 
rebelling against the various circumstances  in your life which press you 
down or regulations in the society which are embedded on you taking your 
freedom away ! Because i went through the same incidents at school as well 
as college... at that time i wasn't going against their rules but against 
their ego and prejudice... and fought alone against them where my other 
classmates decided to stay shut.. !
comments.author: Bhagyashree Nagarkar 이동해

comments.text:
It' really about being an individual and standing up for yourself rather 
than "reballing" they used the school scenerio, because teachers generally 
teach one way, and you can't really disobey them or you'd get punished etc.

comments.text:
+Renegadesfate I think that's an even better take on it since it comes from 
the context of Korean society (even without living there, you can't really 
argue with statistics) rather than general student life. There are 
similarities between every school system, but there's no doubt that Korea 
has a more strict system than most which, I would assume, would add a lot 
of extra pressure in accompaniment to the pressure that comes from a more 
general standard.
This song really means so much more than just rebellion so I feel it's a 
bit sad that I see so many people who think BTS are a bad influence when 
it's really that their songs need need a bit more analysis than just what 
you can gather from the first time you watch the video.
comments.author: powerpuff4ever

comments.text:
I agree. And from what I've heard (I don't live there), a lot of people 
only really consider you successful if you are number one in school, you 
work at a good company, you drive nice cars, etc. I think that this may be 
changing a bit, but I think that's what they are referencing. A lot of 
students are being told (maybe not directly) that they have to be on top or 
they aren't good enough and I believe that  is also why there was a high 
level of suicide amongst high school students. They are in school all day 
and some go to cram schools/hagwons until late at night. Their futures 
(including even their marriages sometimes) are based on how well they do, 
what college they tested into and so on and so forth. It seems extremely 
stressful. They do all this work, but are they really happy. I feel like 
that is the essence of the song, not to rebel per se, but to stand up for 
yourself and don't let what others want for you to overshadow what you 
really want for yourself...just my opinion...
comments.author: Renegadesfate
